condition.description:
Almost everyone has had a headache. Headache is the most common form of pain. It's a major reason people miss days at work or school or visit the doctor.

The most common type of headache is a tension headache. Tension headaches are due to tight muscles in your shoulders, neck, scalp and jaw. They are often related to stress, depression or anxiety. You are more likely to get tension headaches if you work too much, don't get enough sleep, miss meals, or use alcohol.

Other common types of headaches include migraines, cluster headaches, and sinus headaches. Most people can feel much better by making lifestyle changes, learning ways to relax and taking pain relievers.

Not all headaches require a doctor's attention. But sometimes headaches warn of a more serious disorder. Let your health care provider know if you have sudden, severe headaches. Get medical help right away if you have a headache after a blow to your head, or if you have a headache along with a stiff neck, fever, confusion, loss of consciousness, or pain in the eye or ear.

NIH: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke
condition.name: Headache

carousel_items: Don't take Alka-Seltzer if you're allergic to aspirin.
Take it with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
This medicine isn't recommended for kids 12 and younger because it has aspirin in it.
Stop taking this right away and talk to your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, rash, trouble breathing, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.
Having a dental or medical procedure? You may need to stop taking this before the big day. Ask your dentist or doctor.
Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. If you need to follow a low sodium diet a different medication would be better for you.
Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, or gout, or if you're taking medicines to thin your blood.

basics.benefits_moa: Alka-Seltzer is a combination medicine. Sodium bicarbonate is an antacid that relieves heartburn and acid tummy (indigestion). Aspirin is a pain reliever that treats headache and body pains.
basics.bottom_line: Alka-Seltzer gives quick relief for headache, body pains, and upset tummies, but might be hard to swallow if you don't like the taste or fizz.
downsides: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.
Because it has aspirin in it, it increases the risk of bleeding, especially if you take any other blood thinning medicine.
Can't be used by people with allergy to aspirin.
You may not like the taste or fizz.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.
Because it has aspirin in it, it increases the risk of bleeding, especially if you take any other blood thinning medicine.
Can't be used by people with allergy to aspirin.
You may not like the taste or fizz.

upsides: Works great if you have an upset stomach and a headache or body pain at the same time.
Works really fast.
Available over the counter without a prescription.
Cheap.

drugs.name: Alka-Seltzer

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't take Alka-Seltzer if you're allergic to aspirin.
Take it with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
This medicine isn't recommended for kids 12 and younger because it has aspirin in it.
Stop taking this right away and talk to your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, rash, trouble breathing, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.
Having a dental or medical procedure? You may need to stop taking this before the big day. Ask your dentist or doctor.
Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. If you need to follow a low sodium diet a different medication would be better for you.
Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, or gout, or if you're taking medicines to thin your blood.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Alka-Seltzer.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Alka-Seltzer.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sodium levels
risks_warnings.description: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Alka-Seltzer can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of sodium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Alka-Seltzer; a different antacid would be better for you.

description_processed.orig: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Alka-Seltzer can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of sodium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Alka-Seltzer; a different antacid would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: May worsen heart or kidney problems
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. Sodium can raise blood pressure and cause your body to hold on to water. If you have high blood pressure, heart failure, or kidney disease you should not take Alka-Seltzer.

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. Sodium can raise blood pressure and cause your body to hold on to water. If you have high blood pressure, heart failure, or kidney disease you should not take Alka-Seltzer.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage or death from Reye's Syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.
risk_factors: Children 18 years or younger recovering from viral infections

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach Bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer can cause serious stomach problems that include swelling, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life threatening and can cause death. The chances that a stomach problem will occur might be worse the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time.  Watch out for blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.  This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Drinking 3 or more alcoholic drinks a day

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer can cause serious stomach problems that include swelling, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life threatening and can cause death. The chances that a stomach problem will occur might be worse the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time.  Watch out for blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.  This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. This is rare. Stop taking Alka-Seltzer and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. This is rare. Stop taking Alka-Seltzer and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer may cause birth defects. Don't use Alka-Seltzer while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer may cause birth defects. Don't use Alka-Seltzer while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Aspirin is a salicylate and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain. It also prevents blood platelets from forming clots, which thins your blood.
basics.bottom_line: A low dose of Aspirin (81mg) every day can protect your heart, but it's not the best medicine to take for pain, swelling, or fever.
downsides: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

upsides: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

upsides_processed.orig: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves pain, fever, and inflammation. Protects your heart and thins blood.

carousel_items: Starts relieving pain in 30 to 60 minutes.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

basics.benefits_moa: Ibuprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Ibuprofen works well for mild to moderate pain and inflammation, but it doesn't last as long as other NSAIDs.
downsides: Ibuprofen doesn't work as long as other NSAIDs, so follow the package directions on how often you can take it.
It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Ibuprofen doesn't work as long as other NSAIDs, so follow the package directions on how often you can take it.
It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain, swelling, and fevers.
Good for menstrual cramps, toothaches, body aches, and mild arthritis pain.
Ibuprofen works as well as aspirin in treating pain and causes fewer stomach problems.
Ibuprofen works better than acetaminophen (Tylenol) at lowering fever and relieving sinus pain.
Although not without side effects, it's been around for a long time and is generally safe for short-term use.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Ibuprofen can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this problem. Don't take Ibuprofen after having heart surgery for at least two weeks.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Ibuprofen. Don't take Ibuprofen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Ibuprofen.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Ibuprofen. Don't take Ibuprofen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Ibuprofen.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Ibuprofen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Ibuprofen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Lower kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Ibuprofen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Ibuprofen for any amount of time.

description_processed.orig: Ibuprofen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Ibuprofen for any amount of time.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

carousel_items: Takes about 30 minutes to start working and can last about 4 to 6 hours.
Can cause stomach ulcers or bleeding. Don't take it with other blood-thinning medicines without talking to your doctor first.
Can cause headaches. If the headaches continue even after you take a lower dose, talk to your doctor about stopping Indomethacin.
The long-acting capsules must be swallowed whole. Don't crush them.
Take with food or milk to help prevent upset stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Indomethacin is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Indomethacin works well for mild to moderate pain and swelling, but it shouldn't be used long-term since it has some serious side effects.
downsides: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

upsides: Effective option to relieve mild to moderate pain and swelling.
Treats inflammation problems, such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and acute gout attacks.
In studies, Indomethacin was more effective than Tylenol for treating osteoarthritis pain.
It works as well as Celebrex for treating an acute gout attacks.
Available in capsules, long-acting capsules, suppositories, and as a suspension. All forms, except the suspension, are available as generic medications.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney or liver function
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding or bruising
risks_warnings.description: You can bleed or bruise more easily while taking Indomethacin. Tell your doctor about any medicines you are taking or any health conditions before starting Indomethacin. If you take blood-thinning medicines, don't take Indomethacin without talking to your doctor first.

carousel_items: Take it with food to avoid getting diarrhea.
Don't drink alcohol while using Toradol.
Don't take other anti-inflammatory medications (NSAIDs) without talking to your doctor or pharmacist.

Don't take antacids with magnesium since they can interact with Toradol.
Take Toradol at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to prevent an increased risk of heart attack.

basics.benefits_moa: Toradol is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It stops your body from making chemicals that cause inflammation and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Toradol is an okay medication for some types of short-term pain, but don't take it for longer than you really need it.
downsides: Causes increased risk of stomach bleeding, heart attack, and strokes, so you shouldn't take it long-term.
Interacts with a lot of other medications.

downsides_processed.orig: Causes increased risk of stomach bleeding, heart attack, and strokes, so you shouldn't take it long-term.

Available as a generic.

Don't drink alcohol while using Toradol.
Don't take other anti-inflammatory medications (NSAIDs) without talking to your doctor or pharmacist.
Can cause swelling in your legs, abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, and an upset stomach.
Don't take antacids with magnesium since they can interact with Toradol.
Take Toradol at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to prevent an increased risk of heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Toradol can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Toradol during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Toradol can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Toradol during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Toradol can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Toradol can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: Toradol, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Toradol for long periods of time.

description_processed.orig: Toradol, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Toradol for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Toradol. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Toradol. Don't take Toradol while using other blood thinning medications, such as aspirin or ibuprofen, unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Toradol. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Toradol. Don't take Toradol while using other blood thinning medications, such as aspirin or ibuprofen, unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Toradol can negatively affect fetal blood circulation and inhibit uterine contractions, so it shouldn't be used during pregnancy or labor and delivery.

description_processed.orig: Toradol can negatively affect fetal blood circulation and inhibit uterine contractions, so it shouldn't be used during pregnancy or labor and delivery.

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness, fatigue, drowsiness, and dry mouth.
Avoid activities requiring mental alertness (like driving) until you know how it affects you.
Can cause extreme drowsiness or dizziness if you are taking meds for high blood pressure.
Side effects are more prevalent in the elderly.
Don't drink alcohol while using this.
Can be taken with or without food, but you need to be consistent since food affects how the medication is absorbed and works.

basics.benefits_moa: Tizanidine is a muscle relaxer. It works in the nervous system to calm down muscle spasms without interfering with normal muscle function.
basics.bottom_line: Tizanidine isn't a first-choice treatment for muscle spasms. Try other options before using this.
downsides: This isn't a first-choice muscle relaxing medication. Other drugs work better and have fewer side effects.
Tizanidine can lower blood pressure, so be careful if you are already on a blood pressure medication.
Need to be consistent every day in taking this with or without food.
Elderly individuals have more side effects when taking Tizanidine.
Can't stop taking this abruptly if you use it regularly.

downsides_processed.orig: This isn't a first-choice muscle relaxing medication. Other drugs work better and have fewer side effects.
Tizanidine can lower blood pressure, so be careful if you are already on a blood pressure medication.
Need to be consistent every day in taking this with or without food.
Elderly individuals have more side effects when taking Tizanidine.
Can't stop taking this abruptly if you use it regularly.

upsides: Relieves muscle spasms well.
Can be taken with or without food, but you need to be consistent in how you take it every day.
Available as a generic.
Available in a tablet or capsule form. It also comes in a capsule that can be opened and sprinkled in applesauce for people that can't swallow pills.

drugs.name: Zanaflex

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness, fatigue, drowsiness, and dry mouth.
Avoid activities requiring mental alertness (like driving) until you know how it affects you.
Can cause extreme drowsiness or dizziness if you are taking meds for high blood pressure.
Side effects are more prevalent in the elderly.
Don't drink alcohol while using this.
Can be taken with or without food, but you need to be consistent since food affects how the medication is absorbed and works.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Tizanidine can damage your liver. You'll need to get blood tests done to check how your liver is functioning if you're taking this regularly.

description_processed.orig: Tizanidine can damage your liver. You'll need to get blood tests done to check how your liver is functioning if you're taking this regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Falls caused by low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Can cause significant hypotension (low blood pressure) in older people. Be cautious when using this medication, especially when taking other blood pressure drugs, because low blood pressure can make people unsteady and more likely to fall.

description_processed.orig: Can cause significant hypotension (low blood pressure) in older people. Be cautious when using this medication, especially when taking other blood pressure drugs, because low blood pressure can make people unsteady and more likely to fall.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Tizanidine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Tizanidine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal side effects
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking this medication regularly and suddenly stop taking it, you can experience serious withdrawal symptoms, including really high blood pressure and a fast heart rate. In order to stop taking this medication, lower your dose slowly over multiple weeks.

description_processed.orig: If you're taking this medication regularly and suddenly stop taking it, you can experience serious withdrawal symptoms, including really high blood pressure and a fast heart rate. In order to stop taking this medication, lower your dose slowly over multiple weeks.
